nodes.text: Mooxx fat was a lighter-than-air substance that could agglomerate and form clouds in a planet's atmosphere. Warm climates on a Raspar system planet generated this phenomenon, which made the irrigation of arzen fields difficult.

The Mooxx fat was mentioned in a one-page weather forecast titled "Region 29: The West Fissure," written by Bob Carrau for the 1993 book Monsters and Aliens from George Lucas, a publication that collects concept designs and photographs from various George Lucas projects. Lucasfilm employee Leland Chee, who maintains the Holocron continuity database, has indicated that information contained in the book is non-canonical.
